questions.question: Will a Geiger-Muller counter count radioactive events when there is no radioactive source nearby?

answers.a: No, because radioactive rays do not travel very far.
answers.b: Yes, because there are radioactive rays emitted from the desk and human body all the time.
answers.c: Yes, because there are background radiation from space passing through the counter all the time.
answers.d: No, because it is not used for counting radioactive events

questions.question: In an experiment Geiger-Muller counter shows background radiation reading on the counter as 32 counts per minute, when source of beta radiation put in front of the same Geiger-Muller tube the reading on the counter tube is now 560 counts per minute, predict how much radiation is coming from the source of beta radiation
Select the one from the following that is not a disadvantage of Geiger-Muller counter

answers.b: Typically have a large dead time and recovery time

questions.question: The term that defines time from the initial full size countable pulse to the next full size countable pulse produced by the detector is called as
The term that defines time from the initial pulse until the detector can produce another pulse is called as
